poem:
### Beauty Essentials

Desperate for peace,   
we stack promises   
in glass jars, hoping—   
a drop, a dab, then—   
quiet miracles.   
Not whispers,   
but loud truths   
tucked in bottles.   
Yet beneath this skin,  
still the heart's persistent beat:  
faint promises  
in an unlabeled drawer.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Gamechanging beauty products: 17 skin, hair and wellness essentials the experts can’t live without How often do you come across a beauty product that genuinely changes the game? Not just a nice-to-have, but something that actually works, solving a problem you’d given up on. The shampoo that really defrizzes. The foundation that lasts all day without creasing. The serum that calms, rather than irritates, sensitive skin. Most of us have drawers full of abandoned products:". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

The serum that calms, rather than irritates, sensitive skin. Most of us have drawers full of abandoned products:
